qas.question: At what conference did Richard Borshay speak?
When was the Man the Hunter conference?
Why is there a lessening of material possessions in hunting and gathering groups?
What can decreased material possessions produce in a hunter-gatherer society?
What other characteristic is variable for these groups?
A surplus of resources can be accumulated by any member in which societies?
Which 1966 conference did geologists Richard Borshay Lee and Irven DeVore attend?

plausible_answers.text: minimization of material possessions throughout a population

qas.question: The sedentary life of nomadic hunting and gathering societies required what?

plausible_answers.text: one of several central characteristics of nomadic hunting and gathering societies

qas.question: At the 1973 "Man the Hunter" conference egalitarianism was suggested as what?
Other characteristics proposed by Lee and DeVore were stability in territorial boundaries and what?

context: At the <a1_0>1966<a1_0/> <b6_0>"<a0_0>Man the Hunter<a0_0/>"<b6_0/> conference, anthropologists Richard Borshay Lee and Irven DeVore suggested that <a3_0>egalitarianism<a3_0/> was <b8_0>one of several central characteristics of <b5_0>nomadic hunting and gathering societies<b8_0/><b5_0/> because <a2_0>mobility<a2_0/> requires <b7_0>minimization of material possessions throughout a population<b7_0/>. Therefore, no surplus of resources can be accumulated by any single member. Other characteristics Lee and DeVore proposed were flux in <a4_0>territorial boundaries<a4_0/> as well as in <b9_0>demographic composition<b9_0/>.
